item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18865)
item.content:encoded:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “This program helps Colorado’s creative sector endure while...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“This program helps Colorado’s creative sector endure while preserving our vibrant reputation as a great place to live, visit, and do business,” said state Rep. Leslie Herod.

The RedLine Contemporary Art Center will administer the funds in partnership with Colorado Creative Industries."

FOX31 KDVR.com

Colorado Arts Relief Fund grant applications for individuals, organizations and businesses are being accepted through 4:00 p.m. on October 15.

kdvr.com

$15.5M in grants available through Colorado Arts Relief Fund

item.title: "In Colorado, a key proponent of the legislation, state...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In Colorado, a key proponent of the legislation, state representative Leslie Herod says this kind of bill can hold law enforcement to the truth.

“We deserve and the family deserves to know the full story. What are you trying to hide? What don’t you want the community to see about that encounter?” Herod said in an interview with KUSA Denver."

Brendon Galbreath’s family and friends continue to organize rallies demanding transparency in the investigation into Brendon’s death after a police chase in Missoula. “You know I think one thing we are looking for is truth. We are looking for transparency. Since the beginning we ha...

nbcmontana.com|By NBC Montana

Galbreath family continues to ask for transparency in meeting with law enforcement

Brendon Galbreath’s family and friends continue to organize rallies demanding transparency in the investigation into Brendon’s death after a police chase in Missoula. “You know I think one thing we are looking for is truth. We are looking for transparency. item.title: "In the two years since Aurora police and paramedics...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In the two years since Aurora police and paramedics encountered Elijah McClain — which resulted in the 23-year-old's death — Colorado has moved to hold police accountable through laws, courts and investigations, as McClain and other Black people around the country have died at the hands of law enforcement."

Herod, a key force behind SB 217, said in a Sunday tweet honoring Sheneen McClain, "We are not done. The fight continues."

Colorado Politics

In the two years since Aurora police and paramedics encountered Elijah McClain — which resulted in the 23-year-old's death — Colorado has moved to hold police accountable through laws, courts

coloradopolitics.com

Two years after Elijah McClain's death, investigations, legislation and lawsuits move state forward

In the two years since Aurora police and paramedics encountered Elijah McClain — which resulted in the 23-year-old's death — Colorado has moved to hold police accountable through laws, courtsIn the two years since Aurora police and paramedics encountered Elijah McClain — which resulted in the 23-year-old's death — Colorado has moved to hold police accountable through laws, courts
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "State Rep. Leslie Herod has led the charge on police...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"State Rep. Leslie Herod has led the charge on police reform in Colorado and said she would consider looking at legislative changes to make a misdemeanor like the one Haubert was charged with a reason to disqualify someone from becoming POST certified to be a police officer.

“It's definitely something that I will look into, but what I think is more important right now is that our law enforcement agencies need to do an audit of their staff, of their law enforcement,” she said. “I’m concerned that there are more officers like this that continue to be on the streets in Colorado,” Herod said."

Aurora leaders say its Civil Service Commission, which oversees hiring of police officers, needs an overhaul. The outcry comes after a former Aurora police officer was seen on body camera video pistol-whipping and choking a suspect. The officer had a previous criminal record but was still hired.

thedenverchannel.com

City leaders say Aurora’s Civil Service Commission, process for new police hires needs to change

Aurora leaders say its Civil Service Commission, which oversees hiring of police officers, needs an overhaul. The outcry comes after a former Aurora police officer was seen on body camera video pistol-whipping and choking a suspect. The officer had a previous criminal record but was still hired.Aurora leaders say its Civil Service Commission, which oversees hiring of police officers, needs an overhaul. The outcry comes after a former Aurora police officer was seen on body camera video pistol-whipping and choking a suspect. The officer had a previous criminal record but was still hired.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: ALERT 📣🤹🏾‍♀️💃🏻 DENVER (August 23, 2021) --...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

ALERT 📣🤹🏾‍♀️💃🏻

DENVER (August 23, 2021) -- Colorado Creative Industries, a division of the Colorado Office of Economic Development and International Trade (OEDIT), announced today that applications are open for the Colorado Arts Relief Fund for Individuals and the Colorado Arts Relief Fund for Businesses and Organizations.

“According to Americans for the Arts research, 72 percent of Americans believe ‘the arts unify our communities regardless of age, race, sexual orientation... and ethnicity’ and 81 percent say the arts are a ‘positive experience in a troubled world’,” said Representative Leslie Herod. “This program helps Colorado’s creative sector endure while preserving our vibrant reputation as a great place to live, visit, and do business. I’m grateful to my colleagues Senators Jaquez Lewis and Buckner and Representative Benavidez for joining me in championing this second round of funding.”

See MoreDENVER (August 23, 2021) -- Colorado Creative Industries, a division of the Colorado Office of Economic Development and International Trade (OEDIT), announced today that applications are open for the Colorado Arts Relief Fund for Individuals and the Colorado Arts Relief Fund for Businesses and Organ...

oedit.colorado.gov

Applications for Colorado’s $15.5M Arts Relief Program for Individuals, Business and Organizations Now Open | Colorado Office of Economic Development and International Trade

item.title: “Sheneen found herself in a position she never dreamed would...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Sheneen found herself in a position she never dreamed would happen — she was speaking to legislators about laws and testifying before committees about what happened to her son.

Her voice was powerful, said state Rep. Leslie Herod, D-Denver.

“We need real-life experiences to shape public policy,” Herod said. “Her truth and honesty and her passion were important to pass that bill.”

...

Elijah’s death and his mother’s courage to speak out changed the conversation in Colorado, she said.”

The Denver Post

See More“His legacy has to be about what’s right in this world, but, unfortunately, his death is highlighted by what is wrong in the world,” Sheneen McClain told The Denver Post. “Elijah’…

denverpost.com

Two years after Elijah McClain’s death, his mother is deciding how his legacy will be shaped

“His legacy has to be about what’s right in this world, but, unfortunately, his death is highlighted by what is wrong in the world,” Sheneen McClain told The Denver Post. “Elijah’…“His legacy has to be about what’s right in this world, but, unfortunately, his death is highlighted by what is wrong in the world,” Sheneen McClain told The Denver Post. “Elijah’…

item.title: “Colorado law now requires law enforcement officers to stop...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Colorado law now requires law enforcement officers to stop other officers from using excessive force, or report it after it happens.

Otherwise, it is a crime.”

Marshall Zelinger 9News

The case stemmed from an August 2020 arrest and what happened in the jail afterward.

9news.com

Colorado's first 'failure to intervene' case led to $300,000 settlement

The case stemmed from an August 2020 arrest and what happened in the jail afterward.The case stemmed from an August 2020 arrest and what happened in the jail afterward.

item.title: “As of Friday morning, Denver ranks No. 9 on the global list...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“As of Friday morning, Denver ranks No. 9 on the global list of air quality and pollution.” The Denver Post

It is no secret that Denver’s air quality has been bad this past month. But if you look at how it compares on a global scale, you might be surprised on how high the city ranks.

denverpost.com

Denver ranks among the most polluted cities in the world

It is no secret that Denver’s air quality has been bad this past month. But if you look at how it compares on a global scale, you might be surprised on how high the city ranks.It is no secret that Denver’s air quality has been bad this past month. But if you look at how it compares on a global scale, you might be surprised on how high the city ranks.

item.title: “What we’ve seen is that our police accountability bill is...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“What we’ve seen is that our police accountability bill is working. Officers are being charged under SB217, whether it’s for excessive use of force in the field or failure to intervene when excessive force.”

Colorado Public Radio

Colorado's police reform law requires cops to intervene when another officer uses force and, so far, five have faced consequences.

cpr.org

It’s Early, But Colorado’s Police Reform Efforts Have Already Resulted In Charges For Officers

Colorado's police reform law requires cops to intervene when another officer uses force and, so far, five have faced consequences.Colorado's police reform law requires cops to intervene when another officer uses force and, so far, five have faced consequences.

item.title: Recently preliminary redistricting maps were released for...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Recently preliminary redistricting maps were released for Colorado’s state House and Senate. Though we have been assured that these maps will change over time, the approach used to draw the new lines is deeply troubling.

The Denver Post

The process of splitting minority communities into separate districts, a tactic known as “cracking” during gerrymander attempts, has long been used to prevent adequate representation from minoritie…

denverpost.com

Herod and Bacon: Colorado’s Black Caucus has big concerns about redistricting maps

The process of splitting minority communities into separate districts, a tactic known as “cracking” during gerrymander attempts, has long been used to prevent adequate representation from minoritie…The process of splitting minority communities into separate districts, a tactic known as “cracking” during gerrymander attempts, has long been used to prevent adequate representation from minoritie…

item.title: "It is clear here that they exercised that authority...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It is clear here that they exercised that authority inappropriately and contrary to the needs of the community by allowing an officer with a long history of misconduct across two states for both use of force and deceptive behavior,” Brown said of the POST decision in Geiger’s case, adding the board’s exemption power creates a “loophole” in officer discipline that he believes should be legislatively closed.”

Denver7

Two years after Jon Geiger’s conviction, the state’s Peace Officer Standards and Training Board reinstated Geiger — exercising its power, in certain circumstances, to exempt officers convicted of crimes from being decertified.

thedenverchannel.com

Colorado police officer re-certified despite guilty plea

Two years after Jon Geiger’s conviction, the state’s Peace Officer Standards and Training Board reinstated Geiger — exercising its power, in certain circumstances, to exempt officers convicted of crimes from being decertified.Two years after Jon Geiger’s conviction, the state’s Peace Officer Standards and Training Board reinstated Geiger — exercising its power, in certain circumstances, to exempt officers convicted of crimes from being decertified.

item.title: For the first time, Denver has approved a permit to allow people...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

For the first time, Denver has approved a permit to allow people living in their cars to park overnight in a designated area.

The First Universalist Church parking lot will allow up to eight cars.

item.title: “That’s our business model,” Danesh said. “We’re...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“That’s our business model,” Danesh said. “We’re family. You’re coming into my house and I’m your host. It’s amazing how fast you can build relationships when you actually truly start hearing people and talking to them.”

💜 love this place 💜

Familiarity and avocado toast helped Veronica Hudson over the last year -- here's the first business a Denverite reader sent us to celebrate for this series.

item.title: "In legislative politics, there is a perception that...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In legislative politics, there is a perception that politicians must choose between getting things done and risking losing an election or slowing down to hold on to power. From the results of the last two elections and this legislative session, Democrats are looking to prove that to be a false choice in the minds of Colorado voters. We’ll know if they were right or wrong in 2022."

What are your thoughts? Can Democrats be both both and victorious?

https://www.denverpost.com/…/colorado-democrats-2021-state…/

In 2022, the GOP will likely spend a few million bucks going after Democrats on new and increased fees or create a race-based boogeyman about Democrats being soft on crime. There’s no indication th…

denverpost.com

item.title: WASHINGTON — “Senate Democrats announced Tuesday that they...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

WASHINGTON — “Senate Democrats announced Tuesday that they have reached a budget agreement among themselves that envisions spending an enormous $3.5 trillion over the coming decade. The fiscal plan would pave the way for Democrats’ drive to direct a huge pool of federal resources at climate change, health care and family-service programs sought by President Joe Biden.”

The Denver Post

Senate Democrats announced Tuesday that they have reached a budget agreement among themselves that envisions spending an enormous $3.5 trillion over the coming decade. The fiscal plan would pave th…

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM
